str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
